main event: A half-moon shaped object was observed by witnesses on the ground and tracked on radar for approximately 5 minutes on February 6, 1961.
interesting points: The object was observed moving slowly at an elevation of 47.8 degrees and azimuth of 144.7 degrees.
The object was initially thought to be a weather balloon but was determined to be a different type of object.
The size of the object was estimated to be similar to a 40-gram weather balloon at an altitude of 29,000 feet.
An airman who was launching a pilot balloon called another airman to verify the observations at the time of the sighting.
No unusual activity was reported from the Indian Springs tower or Nellis Air Force Base during the time of the sighting.
